snippet: After four killings of young people, a familiar sense of foreboding was joined by a new kind of fear among Israelis and Palestinians.
abstract: Residents of Sderot, Israel, express defiance as Israeli troops mass around Gaza after barrage of rockets; familiar sense of foreboding engulfs Israelis and Palestinians, with both sides preparing for possibility of another of Israel's periodic military blitzes on Gaza.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and JODI RUDOREN
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Sderot, and Jodi Rudoren from Jerusalem. Said Ghazali contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Fares Akram from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: After four killings of young people, a familiar sense of foreboding was joined by a new kind of fear among Israelis and Palestinians.

headline.main: Teenagers’ Deaths Raise Fears of Shift From Political Struggle to Blood Feud
headline.print_headline: Teenagers’ Deaths Raise Fears of Shift From Political Struggle to Blood Feud
